isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - REMOVE - INPUT SHAFT AND INTER-AXLE DIFFERENTIAL ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: INPUT SHAFT AND INTER-AXLE DIFFERENTIAL ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Rotate the carrier so that the input shaft is toward you.

Remove the bolts and the washers that fasten the cover of the drive pinion on the differential carrier. Remove the cover. Remove all gasket material from the cover and the differential carrier ( Figure 14).
Use a suitable tool to hold the input yoke or flange in a stationary position. Loosen, BUT DO NOT REMOVE, the nut on the drive pinion ( Figure 15).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Loosen Nut on Drive Pinion

step1.para: Use a suitable tool to hold the input yoke or flange in a stationary position. Loosen, BUT DO NOT REMOVE, the nut that fastens the yoke or flange to the input shaft ( Figure 16).

figure.caption: Figure 16. Loosen Nut Fastening Yoke or Flange to Input Shaft

step1.para: Remove the bolts and the washers that fasten the input bearing cage to the differential carrier ( Figure 17).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Remove Bolts and Washers Fastening Input Bearing Cage to Differential Carrier

step1.para: Move the carrier so that the input shaft is in a vertical position with the yoke or flange on top. Connect a lifting device to the input yoke.

note.para: Before the input shaft assembly is completely removed from the carrier, paint alignment marks on the helical drive gear and the helical driven gear for easier reassembly of pre-used mated gears.

item.para: Driven Gear: Paint the ends of two adjacent teeth.
Drive Gear: Paint the top land of the matching tooth and guide it into the two painted teeth of the driven gear.

step1.para: Remove the input shaft, the oil pump (if used) and the inter-axle differential from the carrier according to the following procedure.

step3.para: Carefully lift the input shaft assembly from the differential carrier. Tap on the bearing cage with a brass or plastic mallet to separate the cage from the carrier ( Figure 18).
Put the input shaft assembly on a bench.

caution.para: On 160 Series carriers, there are two notches on the side of the inter-axle differential. One of the notches on the case must be aligned with the helical driven gear. If the notch is not aligned over the gear, the gear will prevent the removal of the input shaft assembly and cause damage to the assembly.

step3.para: Lift the input shaft assembly until the bearing cage is separated from the carrier. If necessary, tap on the bearing cage with a brass or plastic mallet to separate the cage from the carrier ( Figure 19).

Remove the input shaft assembly. If the input shaft assembly cannot be removed easily, the case of the inter-axle differential must be rotated. Rotate the input shaft until one of the notches on the case is aligned over the helical driven gear. Remove the input shaft assembly from the carrier ( Figure 20 and Figure 21).

figure.caption: Figure 20. Remove Input Shaft Assembly From Carrier

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. ROTATE SHAFT SO NOTCH ON CASE IS ALIGNED OVER TEETH OF GEAR

figure.caption: Figure 21. Align Notch on Case Over Helical Driven Gear

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. NOTCHES ON CASE MUST BE ALIGNED OVER HELICAL DRIVEN GEAR

step1.para: Remove the shims from between the bearing cage and the differential carrier.
Remove the rear side gear and the bearing cone from the carrier. Remove the collar ( Figure 22).

note.para: If either the bearing cup or cone on the rear side gear needs replacement, both parts must be replaced as a matched set.

warning.para: Observe all warnings and cautions concerning press operation to avoid serious personal injury and possible damage to components.

step1.para: Use a press, a sleeve and a bearing puller to remove the cone from the rear side gear ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Remove Cone From Rear Side Gear

step1.para: Use a brass drift and a hammer to remove the cup of the rear side gear cone from the differential side of the carrier.
